summary: The concept of "national identity" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks pertains to the recognition and preservation of the unique cultural and historical characteristics that define individual member states. It plays a crucial role in shaping policies related to culture and religion, ensuring that the diversity of national identities is respected in the formulation of EU legislation. This concept underpins various legal instruments aimed at promoting cultural heritage, fostering social cohesion, and enhancing mutual respect among nations. The EU acknowledges that national identity is integral to the cultural fabric of Europe, influencing both domestic and supranational governance.
